sentences.en: Cash is the main coinage ( see chart ).
sentences.cn: 现金变成了主要的收购支付手段 ( 见图表 ).

sentences.en: Dragons are the coinage of the brain.
Greek cities kept Greek municipal law and issued their own coinage.
sentences.cn: 希腊城市保留希腊市政法令,并发布他们各自的货币.

sentences.en: I haven't heard that expression before is it a recent coinage?
sentences.cn: 我以前从未听到过这个词语--是最近新造的 吗 ?

sentences.en: It is a very classic translation with the extension of meaning ( coinage? ).
sentences.cn: 当年的翻译很经典,运用了延伸 翻译 技巧.

sentences.en: On December 31 , 1978 , the Coinage Security Fund was merged with the Exchange Fund.
sentences.cn: 一九七八年十二月三十一日, 硬币发行基金与外汇基金合并.

sentences.en: That word is a coinage based on the name of a politician.
sentences.cn: 那是个根据一位政治家的名字新造的词.

sentences.en: The city produced its own coinage from 1325 to 1864.
sentences.cn: 1325年到1864年间，这座城市曾铸造过自己的硬币。

sentences.en: the gold coinage of the Roman empire
The silver coinage was repeatedly debased with copper vellon.
sentences.cn: 银币一再用铜币维隆来替代,实行贬值.

sentences.en: These characteristics led to their being used for jewellery and eventually coinage.
sentences.cn: 这些特性使得它们能成为珍宝,最后用来作货币.

sentences.en: This is the very coinage of your brain.
sentences.cn: 这是你脑中虚构的意象.

sentences.en: This silver - plated copper commemorative medallion with a diameter of 50 mm is made by coinage technique.
sentences.cn: 此枚纪念章为铜质镀银,直径50毫米,造币工艺制造.

sentences.en: Widower is a 14 th century coinage.
sentences.cn: Widower( 鳏夫)一词是十四世纪造出来的.

sentences.en: Yes, in paper currency as well coinage. Modern coins are called token money for that reason.
sentences.cn: 银行家:是的, 无论是纸币还是硬币的发行都是照此办理的, 为此,现代硬币被称之为“辅币”.

words.tran_cn: 创造者；伪造货币者；造币者

trans.tran_cn: 硬币，货币制度，新创的词语
trans.tran_en: the system or type of money used in a country
